root: ^We found some clues and suspicious items...
^but nothing that clearly defines an incident here.
^So all that work was for nothing?? All that effort?
^Well, maybe it wasn't all for nothing?
^What was it for, then?! A night of wandering around someone's house?
^Looking for clues that don't exist, and being satisfied with scraps?
^The only thing we can't check is the box.
^But we looked everywhere and didn't see any signs of a key!
^You know what was really strange, too?
^We didn't see any signs of keys, anywhere.
^Seems kinda weeird for a huge house!
^You'd think there'd be spare keys for everything...
^But the evidence we found does point towards -
^But the only one here with any real motivation to do these investigations...
^Wait, you're blaming me for this whole situation??
^Who else would have a motive to hide all the keys so we would investigate longer?
^I got here after all of you, how would I have hidden the keys?
^And where would I have put them?
^You could have come here earlier in the day...and hidden them then!
^Then got here late and looked innocent!
^You're... really not helping me out, Bingus.
^I've never seen or even been in this house before tonight's events.
^There has to be a logical explanation though! You need to -!!
^The lock is broken! Now we can check what was inside the box!
^Come on, detective, now's the time to clear your name!
^I guess I'll take a look at the contents.
^The key to open the lock... was locked in the box?
^You see, breaking the box is a metaphor for us breaking the cycle of violence, and the key inside
^is a metaphor for looping back to the start, and our inner peace is forever locked inside us with no escape.
^Jean is right, this key wasn't for the box at all.
^It won't even fit in the lock.
^So, if it's not for the box, what door does it open?
^There was a door we couldn't open during the investigation.
^The key could be for that door.
^Ugh, that creepy door? I'll pass, that door just didn't feel right.
^The door felt wrong? That's enough to count me out, I don't do creepy at all.
^I suppose I'm not too curious about what's behind that door after all, but I know you'll bring back the answers for us, Detective!
^None of you are going? You're all just staying here?
^Freyja, you aren't going to go with me?
^Sorry, Detective, but I've seen enough horror movies to know that this is a bad idea.
^I agree with Jean though, you've got it!
^Alright, real cool guys. Had a nice night, and now I'll go investigate the creepy locked place in the mansion.
